summary: "Where the Wild Things Are" is a popular children's book written and illustrated by Maurice Sendak. Published in 1963, it tells the story of a boy named Max who sails to an island inhabited by wild creatures. The book has sold over 19 million copies and has been adapted into movies, an opera, and more. It won the Caldecott Medal in 1964 and was voted the best picture book by librarians in 2012.
title: Where the Wild Things Are
